definition: abbr. for Xinjiang 新疆[Xin1 jiang1] or Singapore 新加坡[Xin1 jia1 po1]/surname Xin
to follow/from/it is for...to/reason/cause/because of/due to/to/to leave it (to sb)/by (introduces passive verb)

sentences.english: Supervision by public opinion is associated with press freedom, an inner meaning of democracy.
sentences.chinese: 輿論監督是新聞自由的一種表現，是民主的應有之義。

sentences.english: Are you satisfied with the existing freedom of press in Hong Kong?
sentences.chinese: 你滿唔滿意而家香港新聞自由程度？

sentences.english: To limited freedom of press is the best choice of authority.
sentences.chinese: 限制新聞自由成爲權力者立法的不二選擇。

sentences.english: New proposals would begin to erode the last bastion of press freedom in the country.
sentences.chinese: 而新的動議將開始侵蝕這片俄國新聞自由的最後據點。

sentences.english: Criminalizing such conduct would threaten the freedom of the press, he said.
sentences.chinese: 將這類接觸歸入刑事犯罪，將危及新聞自由，他表示。

sentences.english: Freedom of the press, as the saying goes, belongs only to thosewho own one.
sentences.chinese: 有句俗語說得好，新聞自由只屬於媒體的擁有者。

sentences.english: Freedom of Press becomes a special right of the news medias when they satisfy citizen's right-to-known.
sentences.chinese: 新聞自由是新聞媒體滿足公民知情權的一項特殊權利。

sentences.english: Press freedom is a pre-requisite for journalistic ethics.
sentences.chinese: 新聞自由是新聞道德的前提條件。

sentences.english: In Africa, Freedom House found significant declines in the level of press freedom.
sentences.chinese: 在非洲，自由之家發現新聞自由的程度出現顯著下降。

sentences.english: The protesting journalists say that was an assult on press freedom.
sentences.chinese: 示威的記者們說，這是對新聞自由的侮辱。

sentences.english: The freedom of the press is one of the great bulwarks of liberty.
sentences.chinese: 新聞自由是自由最大的保障之一。

sentences.english: Protection of journalistic sources is one of the basic conditions for press freedom.
sentences.chinese: 保護記者的消息來源是新聞自由的基本條件之一。

definition: One-China principle, the official doctrine that Taiwan is a province of China
to assess one's income and spend accordingly (idiom); to live within one's means/You can only spend what you earn.
forced labor (as punishment in criminal case)
to stipulate/to state expressly/to explicitly provide for

pinyin: duo1 yuan2 wen2 hua4 zhu3 yi4

definition: Edward Snowden (1983-), American surveillance program whistleblower
to appoint people by favoritism (idiom); nepotism/corrupt appointment
